title: Wayne Rooney's awkward attempt to speak Chinese in restaurant advert is proof Far East snub is a blessing
text:
Sport Wayne Rooney's awkward attempt to speak Chinese in restaurant advert is proof Far East snub is a blessing The Man United forward has confirmed he is staying in the Premier League. Here's why that is good news for everyone... Wayne Rooney is NOT going to China... at least not right this minute anyway. 
The news will no doubt split people between those who will say: "Told you so", those who will be relieved, those who are quietly disappointed, and those who simply couldn't care less about anything else in the world right now. 
Regardless of what camp you're in we're sure you will soon agree that the 31-year-old Manchester United star snubbing a move to the Far East is in fact a good thing. Wayne Rooney has snubbed a move to China (Photo: Triple S Sports & Entertainment Group / YouTube) The Man United forward stars in a toe-curling commercial (Photo: Triple S Sports & Entertainment Group / YouTube) 
Why? Well take a look at the above video. 
The clip, which is a couple of years old, features the England striker in his favourite Chinese restaurant, Wing's, the setting of his 26th birthday party. 
In the video, Rooney wishes his friends in China a Happy New Year, has a go at speaking the language, and takes part in the world's longest - and probably most awkward - handshake. 
Footballers and celebrities are regulars at Wing's, where the cheapest banquet is £34.90 a head. 
The owner Wing Shing Chu, from Hong Kong, is famously discreet. Fancy a kick-about? Rooney is staying at the Old Trafford club (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Former Red Devils manager Louis van Gaal often dined there, following a tradition started by Sir Alex Ferguson. 
When United signed China international Dong Fangzhuo, Mr Wing was brought in to translate. 
Mario Balotelli ordered takeaways to be delivered to his home 25 miles away.
